Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells that contain mixed ionic-electronic conductors (MIECs) as electrolytes exhibit maximum efficiency at high ionic current density due to a small electronic leakage current.
Titulo: Engineering of solid oxide fuel cells with ceria-based electrolytes

Sentencas: At low ionic current density the electronic current increases due to partial reduction of the electrolyte and efficiency decreases.
Titulo: Engineering of solid oxide fuel cells with ceria-based electrolytes

Sentencas: This leads to restrictions in the optimum cell operating range and cell design.
Titulo: Engineering of solid oxide fuel cells with ceria-based electrolytes

Sentencas: Provided the necessary materials and cell design parameters are known, the optimum cell design, especially the electrolyte thickness, can be predicted.
Titulo: Engineering of solid oxide fuel cells with ceria-based electrolytes

Sentencas: The optimization of fuel cells with a mixed-conducting ceria electrolyte is outlined.
Titulo: Engineering of solid oxide fuel cells with ceria-based electrolytes

Sentencas: The cell optimization considered in this study includes operating range (V-T), MIEC thickness, and the electrochemical performance of the electrodes.
Titulo: Engineering of solid oxide fuel cells with ceria-based electrolytes

Sentencas: Defect chemical considerations predict an optimum in MIEC thickness depending on the operating temperature.
Titulo: Engineering of solid oxide fuel cells with ceria-based electrolytes
